Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
American Workers Party Records TAM 441
0.25 Linear Feet (1 box)
circa 1976-1984 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.256.
Historical/Biographical Note
The American Workers Party (1970s-1980s) was a Marxist-Leninst group based in New York City.
Scope and Content Note
This collection of American Workers Party materials consists of four folders: Essays for Basic Study Group; Issue Mailings; Leaflets; Position Papers; and was accompanied by an item-level list of the contents of these folders. The contents include some items by other U.S. Marxist-Leninist organizations. In addition to contemporary issues, a significant portion of the material is concerned with the history and internal politics of the AWP.
Separated Materials
Several pamphlets have been separated for cataloging.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in circa 1976-1984, are expected to enter the public domain in 2104.
Communism -- United States -- 20th century Communist parties |z United States. American Workers Party (New York, N.Y., 197- )
